abstract.t: This document defines an Encrypted ESP Echo Function. a mechanism designed to assess the reachability of an IP Security (IPsec) network path using Encapsulating Security Payload (ESP) packets. The primary objective of this function is to facilitate the detection of end-to- end path status dynamically in a reliable and efficient manner, only using encrypted ESP packets between the IPsec peers. The Encrypted Echo message can use existing congestion control payloads from RFC9347 or the message format specified here, with an optional preferred return path
